definition: to look distracted/to stare blankly/distracted/blank/(coll.) unexpectedly/rash/rashly
Kangxi radical 61 (心) as a vertical side element
to stare blankly/to be in a daze
to do things recklessly/to persist in doing sth in one's own way

sentences.english: He walks out and goes to his downstairs office, and everyone just kind of stands there.
sentences.chinese: 他走了出去返回樓下的辦公室，而所有人都愣在當場。

sentences.english: Before leaving, aguero heard the name of summer Chang An is one leng.
sentences.chinese: 臨離開前，許儀聽到夏常安的名字就是一愣。

sentences.english: Volkswagen car driver to see the "army of young men" are surprised a moment.
sentences.chinese: 大衆車上的男司機見到“軍隊男青年”也是一愣。

sentences.english: Tom went blank and then grinned.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆愣了一下，然後咧開嘴笑了。

sentences.english: Everyone's accompanying is one Leng and follow reputation.
sentences.chinese: 大傢俱是一愣，循聲望去。

sentences.english: Fortunately, people just looked up for a second, no one laugh at him.
sentences.chinese: 還好，衆人只是擡頭一愣，沒人笑他。

sentences.english: He had been just about to cross the wall but when he heard me crying he froze.
sentences.chinese: 他曾剛要越過牆，但是當他聽到我哭了，他愣。

sentences.english: Catherine paused, then said, calmly, "The article was correct.
sentences.chinese: 柯瑟琳愣了一下，然後鎮靜地說，“那篇報道是對的。

sentences.english: The emperor Cha Jie is one Leng, disheveled hair immediately.
sentences.chinese: 帝剎桀一愣，被發現了麼。

sentences.english: I was surprised and I got curious: "What scientific methods?"
sentences.chinese: 我一愣，頓時很有些興趣“什麼科學的方法？”
雅各一下子就愣在那兒了。

sentences.english: George stared morosely at the water.
sentences.chinese: 喬治愁眉苦臉地愣望着河水。

sentences.english: Zhao Lao Die is said by her one Leng, don't know a daughter where the reassurance for coming.
sentences.chinese: 趙老爹被她說得一愣，不知道女兒哪裏來的信心。

sentences.english: She said yes, but there was a pause before she accepted and her enthusiasm seemed luke warm.
sentences.chinese: 她答應了，但是答應之前愣了一下而且顯得並不熱心。

sentences.english: Husband was stupefied , still held me in arms forcibly.
sentences.chinese: 老公愣了一下，還是強行抱住了我。

sentences.english: She picked up a clod of earth on the mountain, and insisted it was a treasure.
sentences.chinese: 她在山上撿了一塊土疙瘩愣說是珍寶。

definition: variant of 愣[leng4]/to look distracted/to stare blankly/distracted/blank
variant of 稜|棱, corner/square beam/edge/arris (curve formed by two surfaces meeting at an edge)/see 楞迦 Sri Lanka
to have heard what was said
to turn one's head/to turn around
to force a smile/a bitter laugh
nutation (plants turning to face the sun)
to turn one's head/to change direction/U-turn/volte face/to repent
half of the day/a long time/quite a while
to look at each other in dismay (idiom)
to scare/to intimidate/to threaten/(interjection showing disapproval) tut-tut/(interjection showing astonishment)
